bunpro.writeup: ごとにis an combination of the nounごと, and the particleに. Together, they are used adverbially to express that something happens 'every (A)', or 'at intervals of (A)'.ごとにmay be used after any verb (usually in non-past form), or noun.Althoughごとにmay be used after verbs, the most common use is with nouns, or phrases that finish with nouns.Cautionごと is the訓読み (Japanese reading) of the kanji毎, which means 'every'. This fact will be important when trying to remember the difference betweenごとにandおきに, a similar grammar point which can also mean 'every', but focuses more on 'interval' or 'gap' of a specific time or distance. Due toおきにfocusing on the space between 'each (A)', there are sentences whereおきにandごとにwill have different meanings.Here, we can see thatごとにwill mean 'every week', whileおきにwill mean 'every second week', due to there being a 'one week interval' whenおきにis used. To make things easier, these two expressions can be remembered in the following way.(A)ごとに= During every (A), (B).(A)おきに= After every space of (A), (B).Fun FactMany native speakers make mistakes with the difference betweenおきにandごとに, so there are quite a large number of people (especially in the younger generation) that will consider them completely interchangeable.

examples.japanese: 失敗をする経験は無駄ではありません。失敗をするごとに上達します。
examples.english: Failing is not a pointless experience. Every time you fail, you improve.

examples.japanese: 私は3時間ごとにお菓子を食べます。
私は一週間ごとに実家に帰ります。
examples.english: I go to my parents' home every week. (Every single one)

examples.japanese: 私は一週間おきに実家に帰ります。
examples.english: I go to my parents' home every other week. (With 'spaces' or 'gaps' of 1 week)

examples.japanese: 彼女は運転中、赤信号毎に、携帯を見る。
examples.english: She looks at her phone at every red light while driving.

examples.japanese: あのチームは、試合をする毎に強くなっている。
examples.english: That team is getting stronger with every match.

examples.japanese: 夏毎にアメリカに帰ります。
examples.english: Every summer I go back to America.
I gave a paper to every student. (Each)

examples.japanese: 二日毎に友達とサッカーをする。
examples.english: I play soccer with my friend every two days. (at two day intervals)

false_friends.meaning: Times (In each time period), Every, Frequency of
Almost every ~, Nearly every ~, On a ~ basis
Repeated at intervals, Every other, Every, At intervals of

dojg.description: Something takes place regularly in succession after a certain temporal or spatial interval.

examples.japanese: (ksa).私は三時間ごとに薬を飲んだ・飲みました。
examples.english: I took medicine every three hours.

examples.japanese: (ksb).正月は家ごとに門松を立てる・立てます。
examples.english: They put up pine tree decorations at every house on New Year's Day.
There is a test after every lesson.

examples.japanese: (c).木村さんは会う人ごとに挨拶している。
examples.english: Mr. Kimura greets everyone he meets.

examples.japanese: (d).三日ごとにテニスをしています。
examples.english: I'm playing tennis every third day.
